column4: Am I the only one ripping CD's with the paranoia options enabled in grip?  How much of a waste of time is that stuff?
i always rip with full paranoia
it's a bigger waste of time to have to do is again
and what speed does grip rip for you?  It's ripping for me at 0.1x
oh that's terrible.  i get about 16x
is dma working?
hdparm?
well, i ran the command to enable it, no idea if it's working or not though
yeah sometimes it doesn't enable for various reasons.  just run hdparm /dev/hdc to check it
it says "using_dma = 1 (on)"
well that was my only idea :)  is the disc scratched?
when you couldn't get dma enabled, did hdparm report it as enabled?
no it stayed as dma = 0
no idea, it's just been going while i've been off doing other things.  It's been more than three hours though I know.
okay, so probably I do have dma enabled.
another good idea, i'll do that after this one rips
it's just the controller integrated into my SuperMicro P6DBE motherboard.
is the piix module loaded?
piix shows up in the output of lsmod, so I guess it is.
you're on a server?
i operate a lot of servers ... that's a postgresql server
ah, i was here wondering if it made any sense to have 8GB on a desktop, but apparently, you're not using one
do you have a line like this in your dmesg?  Uniform Multi-Platform E-IDE driver Revision: 7.00alpha2
i'm ripping this cd to a network share.  Is it possible that the network is so slow that it's slowing down my rip this much?
